text:
HubSpot is (likely) going to pause doing an official "Developer Day" for this year.

We realllllly want to, however, we really need to tackle a few other important initiatives (docs v2.0, redesign design/dev website, launch code gallery, local dev tools, etc). We're a small team, so in order to get those other items done we had to pause on Developer Day.

That said, ya'll could definitely organize sooooomething. We can help facilitate where possible. :slightly_smiling_face:
I'd imagine without an official "Developer Day" happening, there won't be many developers attending INBOUND this year.

We're also exploring the possibility of doing a virtual event (to be inclusive to anyone, anywhere) in Q4 after INBOUND. But really depends on how those other initiatives are going.
:disappointed:
welp
is it because i am going?
i will stay home if you want me to
haha, they were afraid emmets would outshine the other activities(kidding)
lol
ha!
emmets loves all.  it makes us all shine brighter

<@U22PKFRU5> what if we had the following:
- A room at Inbound for Developers to get together in? Maybe have a presentation or two a day from different devs in the community (similar to the presentation that was done last year)/
- (as much as we joked about the emmet area) a community developer assistance area where some of the devs would commit to spending a few hours in a help area so any company attending can get first hand help from devs from different agencies (like a see how awesome our partners are type thing)
- I had a third idea but i can't remember it now
I would totally be up for sitting around for a few hours a day to help people with any dev related issues they have.
and i can juggle

I would sit around giving help as well.

This micro developer day thing could work simpler than last year. 1 room 1 projector, 1 podium or heck just a table with a table cloth, a handful of power strips for the emmets dev genius bar.

Someone’s company can sponsor like 1 type of beer to be at the dev bar.(could put a hard limit 1 beer per hour that you provide help, and x beers to give to people who you help). Beer idea is just to be fun and make it more welcoming. If someone abused it we’d just kick em out. doubt there’d really be issues. Inbound is a professional event.

If HubSpot feels it’s too expensive to do, could probably get a partner agency to sponsor it
I think with your juggling and <@U26D0TF8E> awesome aerial skills, it would be awesome to put on a show
do you happen to do face paint?
I am a pretty good artist so maybe lol
no but if I remember correctly he does flooring
that is <@U38EZFVFE>
flooring is chad
lol
ahh
and stairs
lol

HAHA i just watched that telethon episode over the weekend
hehe
I hold my secrets close to chest

I have my own silks #justSaying
all I need is a beam
all i need are at least 3 objects.
preferably small
1 live chinchilla, 1 helium atom, and 1 ant coming up Dennis

prepare yourselves to be wowed

<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/CCGU4R4ER/p1559594879041500?thread_ts=1559587691.032700&cid=CCGU4R4ER>

“I’m sorry Dennis, I lost the ant in the TSA scanning machine”
a good yarn to tell at emmets
